ibis.constellation

Class ConstellationProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • ibis.constellation.ConstellationProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>

    public class ConstellationProperties
extends java.util.Properties
    This class defines the properties that affect the behavior of constellation.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • S_PREFIX

        public static final java.lang.String S_PREFIX
        All properties start with the prefix "ibis.constellation.".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • S_DISTRIBUTED

        public static final java.lang.String S_DISTRIBUTED
        The "distributed" property is a boolean property instructing the ConstellationFactory whether to create a distributed constellation or not. The default is "true".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DISTRIBUTED

        public final boolean DISTRIBUTED

      • S_STEALSTRATEGY

        public static final java.lang.String S_STEALSTRATEGY
        The "stealing" property is a string property defining the steal strategy to use. There are three:
        "pool" indicates: steal from anyone
        "mw" indicates: master-worker, so only steal from master
        "none" indicates: don't steal at all.
        The default value is: "pool".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STEALSTRATEGY

        public final java.lang.String STEALSTRATEGY

      • S_REMOTESTEAL_THROTTLE

        public static final java.lang.String S_REMOTESTEAL_THROTTLE
        The "remotesteal.throttle" property is a boolean property indicating whether only one outstanding remote steal request per UnitExecutorContext is allowed. The default value is "false".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REMOTESTEAL_THROTTLE

        public final boolean REMOTESTEAL_THROTTLE

      • S_REMOTESTEAL_TIMEOUT

        public static final java.lang.String S_REMOTESTEAL_TIMEOUT
        The "remotesteal.timeout" property is an integer property indicating the timeout for remote steal requests, in milliseconds. The default is "5000".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REMOTESTEAL_TIMEOUT

        public final int REMOTESTEAL_TIMEOUT

      • S_PROFILE

        public static final java.lang.String S_PROFILE
        The "profile" property is a boolean property indicating whether constellation should provide some timing information. The default is "false".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROFILE

        public final boolean PROFILE

      • S_PROFILE_COMMUNICATION

        public static final java.lang.String S_PROFILE_COMMUNICATION
        The "profile.communication" property is a boolean property indicating whether constellation should provide some timing information on steal or event messages. The default is "false". Note: the overhead for this profiler can be large.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROFILE_COMMUNICATION

        public final boolean PROFILE_COMMUNICATION

      • S_PROFILE_ACTIVITY

        public static final java.lang.String S_PROFILE_ACTIVITY
        The "profile.activity" property is a boolean property indicating whether constellation should provide some timing information on the activity methods Activity.cleanup(Constellation), Activity.process(Constellation, Event), and Activity.initialize(Constellation). The default is "false".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROFILE_ACTIVITY

        public final boolean PROFILE_ACTIVITY

      • S_PROFILE_STEAL

        public static final java.lang.String S_PROFILE_STEAL
        The "profile.steal" property is a boolean property indicating whether constellation should provide some timing information on steals. The default is "false". Note: the overhead for this profiler can be large.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROFILE_STEAL

        public final boolean PROFILE_STEAL

      • S_PROFILE_OUTPUT

        public static final java.lang.String S_PROFILE_OUTPUT
        The "profile.output" property is a string property indicating an output file to write profile info to. If not specified (default), System.out is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROFILE_OUTPUT

        public final java.lang.String PROFILE_OUTPUT

      • S_STATISTICS

        public static final java.lang.String S_STATISTICS
        The "printStatistics" property is a boolean property indicating whether some constellation statistics should be printed or not. Default is "false". See also S_STATISTICS_OUTPUT.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATISTICS

        public final boolean STATISTICS

      • S_STATISTICS_OUTPUT

        public static final java.lang.String S_STATISTICS_OUTPUT
        The "statistics.output" property is a string property indicating an output file to write statistics to. If not specified (default), System.out is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STATISTICS_OUTPUT

      • S_STEAL_DELAY

        public static final java.lang.String S_STEAL_DELAY
        The "steal.delay" property is an integer property, specifying the minimum time interval between failed steal attempts, in milliseconds. The default is "20".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STEAL_DELAY

        public final int STEAL_DELAY

      • S_STEAL_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String S_STEAL_SIZE
        The "steal.size" property is an integer property, specifying how many activities to try and steal on each steal attempt, for local steals. The default is "1".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • S_REMOTESTEAL_SIZE

        public static final java.lang.String S_REMOTESTEAL_SIZE
        The "remotesteal.size" property is an integer property, specifying how many activities to try and steal on each steal attempt, for remote steals. The default is "1".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Value of the "steal.size" property.

      • S_STEAL_IGNORE_EMPTY_REPLIES

        public static final java.lang.String S_STEAL_IGNORE_EMPTY_REPLIES
        The "steal.ignoreEmptyReplies" property is a boolean property determining whether empty steal replies should be given or not. The default is "false".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STEAL_IGNORE_EMPTY_REPLIES

        public final boolean STEAL_IGNORE_EMPTY_REPLIES
        Value of the "steal.ignoreEmptyReplies" property.

      • S_CLOSED

        public static final java.lang.String S_CLOSED
        The "closed" property is a boolean property indicating whether the current run is a closed run, that is, whether the total number of nodes involved is fixed. If true, the property "poolSize" should be set to the number of nodes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLOSED

        public final boolean CLOSED
        Value of the "closed" property.

      • S_POOLSIZE

        public static final java.lang.String S_POOLSIZE
        The "poolSize" property is an integer property indicating the pool size if the current run is a closed run, that is, when the total number of nodes involved is fixed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POOLSIZE

        public final int POOLSIZE
        Value of the "closed" property.

      • S_MASTER

        public static final java.lang.String S_MASTER
        The "master" property is a boolean property indicating whether the current constellation instance is a candidate to be the master. At least one of the constellation instances should be. See Constellation.isMaster(). The default is "true". Note that only one constellation instance will actually become the master. For that instance, Constellation.isMaster() will return true, for the other instances it will return false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MASTER

        public final boolean MASTER
        Value of the "master" property.

      • S_QUEUED_JOB_LIMIT

        public static final java.lang.String S_QUEUED_JOB_LIMIT
        When an executor spawns new activities, these new activities are initially added to queues that are local to this executor. This makes them easily accessible for this executor, but not so easily accessible for other executors. The "queue.limit" property defines the maximum length of these local queues. When this limit is reached, new activities are pushed onto queues higher up in the system, making them more easily accessible for other executors. The default value is "100".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUEUED_JOB_LIMIT

        public final int QUEUED_JOB_LIMIT
        Value of the "queue.limit" property.
